verses.verse: Hold not your <S%H2790>peace<s%>, O <S%H430>God<s%> of my <S%H8416>praise<s%>;

For the <S%H6310>mouth<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> and the <S%H6310>mouth<s%> of the <S%H4820>deceitful<s%> are <S%H6605>opened<s%> against <S%H1696>me<s%>: they have spoken against me with a <S%H8267>lying<s%> <S%H3956>tongue<s%>.
They <S%H5437>surrounded<s%> me about also with <S%H1697>words<s%> of <S%H8135>hatred<s%>; and <S%H3898>fought<s%> against me without a <S%H2600>cause<s%>.
For my <S%H160>love<s%> they are my <S%H7853>adversaries<s%>: but I give myself unto <S%H8605>prayer<s%>.
And they have <S%H7760>rewarded<s%> me <S%H7451>evil<s%> for <S%H2896>good<s%>, and <S%H8135>hatred<s%> for my <S%H160>love<s%>.
<S%H6485>Set<s%> you a wicked <S%H7563>man<s%> over <S%H7854>him<s%>: and let Satan <S%H5975>stand<s%> at his right <S%H3225>hand<s%>.
When he shall be <S%H8199>judged<s%>, let him <S%H3318>be<s%> <S%H7563>condemned<s%>: and let his <S%H8605>prayer<s%> become <S%H2401>sin<s%>.
Let his <S%H3117>days<s%> be <S%H4592>few<s%>; and let <S%H312>another<s%> <S%H3947>take<s%> his <S%H6486>office<s%>.
Let his <S%H1121>sons<s%> be <S%H3490>fatherless<s%>, and his <S%H802>wife<s%> a <S%H490>widow<s%>.
Let his <S%H1121>sons<s%> be <S%H5128>continually<s%> <S%H5128>vagabonds<s%>, and <S%H7592>beg<s%>: let them <S%H1875>seek<s%> their bread also out of their desolate <S%H2723>places<s%>.
Let the <S%H5383>extortioner<s%> <S%H5367>catch<s%> all that he <S%H2114>has<s%>; and let the strangers <S%H962>plunder<s%> his <S%H3018>labor<s%>.
Let there be none to <S%H4900>extend<s%> <S%H2617>mercy<s%> unto <S%H2603>him<s%>: neither let there be any to favor his fatherless <S%H3490>sons<s%>.
Let his <S%H319>posterity<s%> be cut <S%H3772>off<s%>; and in the <S%H1755>generation<s%> <S%H312>following<s%> let their <S%H8034>name<s%> be blotted <S%H4229>out<s%>.
Let the <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> of his <S%H1>fathers<s%> be <S%H2142>remembered<s%> with the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>; and let not the <S%H2403>sin<s%> of his <S%H517>mother<s%> be blotted <S%H4229>out<s%>.
Let them be before the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> <S%H8548>continually<s%>, that he may cut <S%H3772>off<s%> the <S%H2143>memory<s%> of them from the <S%H776>earth<s%>.

Because that he <S%H2142>remembered<s%> not to <S%H6213>show<s%> <S%H2617>mercy<s%>, but <S%H7291>persecuted<s%> the <S%H6041>poor<s%> and <S%H34>needy<s%> <S%H376>man<s%>, that he might even <S%H4191>kill<s%> the <S%H3512>broken<s%> in <S%H3824>heart<s%>.
As he <S%H157>loved<s%> <S%H7045>cursing<s%>, so let it <S%H935>come<s%> unto <S%H2654>him<s%>: as he delighted not in <S%H1293>blessing<s%>, so let it be far from <S%H7368>him<s%>.

As he <S%H3847>clothed<s%> himself with <S%H7045>cursing<s%> like as with his <S%H4055>garment<s%>, so let it <S%H935>come<s%> into his <S%H7130>bowels<s%> like <S%H4325>water<s%>, and like <S%H8081>oil<s%> into his <S%H6106>bones<s%>.
Let it be unto him as the <S%H899>garment<s%> which <S%H5844>covers<s%> <S%H4206>him<s%>, and for a belt with which he is <S%H2296>girded<s%> <S%H8548>continually<s%>.
Let this be the <S%H6468>reward<s%> of my <S%H7853>adversaries<s%> from the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, and of them that <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%> against my <S%H5315>soul<s%>.
But <S%H6213>do<s%> you for <S%H3069>me<s%>, O God the <S%H136>Lord<s%>, for your <S%H8034>name<s%>'s <S%H2617>sake<s%>: because your mercy is <S%H2896>good<s%>, deliver you <S%H5337>me<s%>.
For I am <S%H6041>poor<s%> and <S%H34>needy<s%>, and my <S%H3820>heart<s%> is <S%H2490>wounded<s%> inside <S%H7130>me<s%>.
I am <S%H1980>gone<s%> like the <S%H6738>shadow<s%> when it <S%H5186>declines<s%>: I am tossed up and <S%H5287>down<s%> as the <S%H697>locust<s%>.
My <S%H1290>knees<s%> are <S%H3782>weak<s%> through <S%H6685>fasting<s%>; and my <S%H1320>flesh<s%> <S%H3584>fails<s%> of <S%H8081>fatness<s%>.
I became also a <S%H2781>reproach<s%> unto <S%H7200>them<s%>: when they looked upon me they <S%H5128>shaked<s%> their <S%H7218>heads<s%>.
<S%H5826>Help<s%> <S%H3068>me<s%>, O Lord my <S%H430>God<s%>: O <S%H3467>save<s%> me according to your <S%H2617>mercy<s%>:
That they may <S%H3045>know<s%> that this is your <S%H3027>hand<s%>; that <S%H3068>you<s%>, Lord, have done <S%H6213>it<s%>.
Let them <S%H7043>curse<s%>, but <S%H1288>bless<s%> <S%H6965>you<s%>: when they arise, let them be <S%H954>ashamed<s%>; but let your <S%H5650>servant<s%> <S%H8055>rejoice<s%>.
Let my <S%H7853>adversaries<s%> be <S%H3847>clothed<s%> with <S%H3639>shame<s%>, and let them <S%H5844>cover<s%> themselves with their own <S%H1322>confusion<s%>, as with a <S%H4598>mantle<s%>.
I will <S%H3966>greatly<s%> <S%H3034>praise<s%> the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> with my <S%H6310>mouth<s%>; <S%H1984>Yes<s%>, I will praise him <S%H8432>among<s%> the <S%H7227>multitude<s%>.
For he shall <S%H5975>stand<s%> at the right <S%H3225>hand<s%> of the <S%H34>poor<s%>, to <S%H3467>save<s%> him from those that <S%H8199>condemn<s%> his <S%H5315>soul<s%>.
